conclusion: Analyze motion using v-t graphs to determine if displacement difference is continuously increasing.
The v-t graph shows how the velocity of each object changes over time.
The area under the curve of each object's graph represents its displacement over time.
Displacement from time 0 to t1 is determined by calculating the area under the curve.
Difference in displacement is the difference in areas under the curves.
If area under curve A is consistently greater than under curve B, displacement difference is increasing.
Object A has a higher velocity than object B at all times within the interval.
Velocity is the rate of change of displacement.
Higher velocity means a greater rate of change of displacement.
Area under curve A will always be greater than under curve B, so displacement difference is increasing.
The difference in displacement is necessarily continuously increasing from 0 to t1.
